body:
@fjy  @drcrallen I  think this pull request that I submitted have defects. Inner query  really should  build on sub query.look following SQL

``` sql
SELECT  COUNT(*) as cc,LONG_SUM(click) as c from (select cast,LONG_SUM(click_sum) as click from dsp_report where interval BETWEEN  2016-01-20 AND 2016-01-21) where interval BETWEEN  2016-01-20 AND 2016-01-21;
```

compile to  JSON

``` json
{
  "intervals": {
    "intervals": ["2016-01-20/2016-01-21"],
    "type": "intervals"
  },
  "granularity": "all",
  "dataSource": {
    "query": {
      "intervals": {
        "intervals": ["2016-01-20/2016-01-21"],
        "type": "intervals"
      },
      "granularity": "all",
      "dataSource": {
        "name": "dsp_report",
        "type": "table"
      },
      "aggregations": [{
        "fieldName": "click_sum",
        "name": "click",
        "type": "longSum"
      }],
      "postAggregations": [],
      "queryType": "groupBy",
      "dimensions": ["cast"]
    },
    "type": "query"
  },
  "aggregations": [{
    "name": "cc",
    "type": "count"
  }],
  "postAggregations": [],
  "queryType": "groupBy",
  "dimensions": ["click"]
}

```

inner query's aggregation 'click' turned to outer query's dimension,If use the build that merged this PR,will return wrong result,because inner query don't have 'click' dimension.
Following SQL is mentioned in those issue are misused. As much as possible,The WHERE condition and aggregations are inside inner query.
#1632 

``` sql
SELECT 
   device, LONG_SUM(pv) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(hyper_uv) as hyper_uv 
FROM
  (SELECT
         device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
   FROM dsp_report        
   WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00
   AND area = '0A' BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device, cast
   ) 
WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00 AND cast = 1 BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device ;
```

proper usage:

``` sql
SELECT 
   device, LONG_SUM(pv) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(hyper_uv) as hyper_uv 
FROM
  (SELECT
         device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
   FROM dsp_report        
   WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00
   AND area = '0A' and cast=1 BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device
   ) 
WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00 BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device ;
```

#1825 

``` sql
  select COUNT(*) as rows from (select a b from t1 group by a,b)
```

proper usage:

``` sql
   select COUNT(*)  from t1 group by a,b
```

Issue #1036 
Can count() be inside inner query?

@sirpkt if the you be using lookup, you wan't be able to get the registered object via the lookup ref manager, which is the use case that you want to support.  Probably you can get around by having another lookup delegate.
@drcrallen can you please take a look at this.
Done
PR https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1576 and https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2517 are addressing point 2.
I will be working on adding some introspection endpoint via HTTP, that allows user to introspect lookups at run time.
@b-slim what kind of introspection?
@drcrallen it will depends on what lookup impl exposes, for instance maybe a prefix search.

@b-slim cool, just FYI, at this point I'm planning on:
1. seeing cluster wide config over the finish line
2. making sure the extensions get updated properly
3. Adding more docs for QTL

and other than that hoping you can drive for some of the other features you've been working on.  I _THINK_ only the cluster wide config stuff is a blocker for your items.
lgtm, :+1: after conflict resolution & travis
fixed conflicts
I left some comments that I could be taken or could be not taken.  I think it's fine as is and am ready to :+1: as is if none of the feedback is taken.

FYI there is an issue here hinted at in https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/1576

If a node is down when a DROP request propagates across the cluster, the coordinator has no idea if the Lookups a node contains when it comes back up are custom added or still present from the failed DROP (since the node was down)
Would it be possible that one task have two different TaskLocations at the same time?
@guobingkun @drcrallen going to merge this in 24 hours and then refactor extensions
@drcrallen going to merge this in 24 hours and then refactor extensions
@drcrallen @b-slim @cheddar can u guys review this and coordinate over development?

@fjy You had a thumbs up and I didn't see anything from xavier yet, though I haven't heard any complaints from him yet either. Didn't realized this was blocked on me instead of xavier.  Merging to a extensions.contrib should be good.
@drcrallen thinking about merging this after extensions.contrib exists
@fjy before merging contrib PRs please make sure they are squashed into logical commits.
This one's probably ok
@himanshug why an extension?
:+1: @jon-wei after this is merged can you backport to 0.9.0?
@drcrallen Sure, I'll backport to 0.9.0
are the groupids in the poms supposed to be extensions.contrib, not core?
@drcrallen What's the process for backporting?
I agree with @himanshug on this point.
https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2533/files#diff-d19c7676e29a15ee2e34062c8e4ee6eaR720 was supposed to take care of array , why is that still needed?
@drcrallen oops

@himanshug see top comment regarding [JsonConfigurator](https://github.com/druid-io/druid-api/blob/master/src/main/java/io/druid/guice/JsonConfigurator.java#L84). In my tests I had somehow missed getting a config to pass through JsonConfigurator.

@jon-wei roughly:
 (note that I have druid --> druid-io and metamx --> metamx ... substitute your origin and remote appropriately)

```
$ git fetch druid
$ git checkout druid/0.9.0
$ git checkout -b backport2536
$ git cherry-pick fd3782522c4bbbaeb3f847bf5cb2b0dc73840e53
$ git push metamx/backport2536
```

If there are conflicts in the cherry-pick then you'll have to fix them and do

```
$ git add <<<now-fixed-files>>> 
$ git cherry-pick --continue
```

before the push

Then submit a PR as normal, but choose the 0.9.0 branch instead of master for where you are submitting it.
@fjy rebased
@drcrallen thanks, will backport now
@guobingkun a task should only have one location at a time, if it is running in two places then the RTR should kill the one it doesn't like
Cool, :+1: but suggest removing https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2419#discussion-diff-54020855R24

fixed by #2536
I'm waiting for this feature. Especially, this feature will be very helpful in my area(semiconductor industry). Do you have any plan to add this feature?
@i1befree yes, we're backlogged on reviewing PRs right now. THis shoudl go in 0.9.1 or 0.9.2

I think this failed due to #2430 

(https://travis-ci.org/druid-io/druid/builds/111621322)

```
testSessionKilled(io.druid.curator.announcement.AnnouncerTest)  Time elapsed: 61.322 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.lang.Exception: test timed out after 60000 milliseconds
    at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
    at io.druid.curator.announcement.AnnouncerTest.testSessionKilled(AnnouncerTest.java:176)
```

in QuotableWhiteSpaceSplitter , code that handles a json string is never used because it can never receive a json array and hence should be removed.

also, I would deprecate javaOpts .

also can you add some test for ForkingTaskRunnerConfig that creates ForkingTaskRunnerConfig instance using ObjectMapper and ensure javaOptsArray can work with various special characters one expects to see.

@b-slim Oh, I just read about #2329 
So, in the near future, every lookup extractor will be managed by lookup ref manager,
but not yet now especially for namespace lookup extensions including kafka namespace, right?

I have two questions
1. If I use static configuration for namespace as before (and not register lookup extractor factory to lookup ref manager), then, can I use that namespace as before by using `lookup` of LookupDimensionSpec?
2. Is there any good example code to reference for registering lookup extractor factory? It seems like I have to register my lookup extractor factory to every node (or coordinator node after step 2 of #2329 is completed?) but there exists no interface to register.
@himanshug the ForkingTaskRunnerTest already had some special stuff in it. I re-used part of it and built a more full featured injection test suite for the config.
Moved to extension
@fjy Thanks for your answer. I hope this feature to be included in Druid soon.

Again, I've already suggested to merging this into existing filter, API or interface, whatever it called at first. And also I like user readable expression(where) which is suggested @cheddar and it's the way to be  done ultimately.

Ok, you win. I'll close this.
I've updated the occurrences of the defaults which I could find, I hope none slipped past me. An extra set of eyes on this would be nice.

@gianm Yes, I think that is a viable feature request but outside the scope of this bug fix.

I've tried testing it without much luck. I have statsd running on each node. Pushing metrics manually works:
`echo "Druid/test:5|c" | nc -u -w0 127.0.0.1 8125`

However Druid doesn't appear to send anything. I'm running 0.9.0-SNAPSHOT with this patch applied. Config:

```
druid.emitter=statsd
druid.emitter.statsd.hostname=127.0.0.1
druid.emitter.statsd.port=8125
```

Thoughts on how to debug this?

@danosipov try with 
`druid.emitter.statsd.hostname=localhost`

Otherwise, that matches my setup.

Also, check the logs for 
`"Failed to start StatsD client"` If the StatsD client fails to start a RuntimeException is thrown (StatsDClientException) and the Emitter won't be started.
This is probably served better in extensions.contrib than in a PR, so :+1: to go into extensions.contrib
